 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.

violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.

If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION:
07/21/21, Youth A asked Youth C if she could give him a hickey. He said "Yes" as
she proceeded to give him one. Youth C has a very faint mark on his neck today.
There is no bruising. This happened around 8pm at the facility.
INVESTIGATION:
On July 26, 2021 I interviewed Director and Supervisor in person at the facility to
inform them of the complaint. Supervisor reported Youth C is homosexual and the
boys were bulling him and making Youth C uncomfortable. Due to these reasons
Youth C was moved from the boy’s unit and had been residing on the girl’s unit.
2

Director reported Youth C was discharged from the facility on July 25, 2021 to his
parents. A list of staff and youth to interview was provided to the Director. Video
footage and documents were reviewed as part of this investigation.
On July 26, 2021 I interviewed Youth A in person at the facility. Youth A was upset
and told me several times that she thought it was “stupid” that I was asking her
about the hickey. Youth A stated it was a “joke” and did not understand why this
was a “big deal.” Youth A reported Youth C is not even attracted to females and
kept asking why I was asking her questions. Youth A reported she could not
remember what staff were working and told me she was “done talking” as she stood
up and walked out of the room.
On July 26, 2021 I interviewed Youth B in person at the facility. Youth B reported
she was with Youth A in Youth C’s bedroom when Youth C asked Youth A to give
him a hickey. Youth B stated Youth C thought it would be funny to go home with a
hickey on his neck. Youth B stated Youth A and Youth C discussed this when in
Youth B’s bathroom while making jewelry for Youth C’s nose ring. Youth B stated a
staff checked on them once and told Youth A and Youth B they could not be in
Youth C’s bedroom. Youth B reported Youth A and herself stood in Youth C’s
doorway to talk with Youth C while the staff person went into the staff office. Youth
B could not remember who the staff person was that was working.
Youth B reported the staff person was either in the office or in the hallway so Youth
A and herself went back into Youth C’s bedroom. Youth B reported they were in the
bedroom for one to two minutes when Youth A gave Youth C a hickey on his neck. .
Youth B reported they all started laughing and went to tell staff what happened.
Youth B stated it was just a “joke.” Youth B reported Youth A and herself were not
supposed to be in Youth C’s bedroom or bathroom.
On July 28, 2021 I interviewed Youth C by telephone. Youth C stated Youth A
asked to give him a hickey on his neck and he told her that was “fine.” Youth C
stated Youth A, Youth B and himself were hanging out in his bathroom and Staff 1
was “not watching at all.” Youth C stated, “this really is not a big deal.” Youth C
reported Youth A and Youth B were in and out of his bedroom and bathroom a few
times that day. Youth C reported no other youth are supposed to be in his bedroom
or bathroom.
On July 26, 2021 I interviewed Staff 1 in person at the facility. Staff 1 reported she
had caught Youth A and Youth B in Youth C’s bathroom making jewelry and told
Youth A and Youth B they could not be in Youth C’s bathroom or bedroom. Staff 1
reported another youth on the unit approached her and wanted to go to the
basketball court. Staff 1 reported she stepped off the unit and took this youth to
meet another staff person so that staff person could take that youth to the basketball
court leaving Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and one other youth alone on the unit.
Staff 1 reported she came back onto the unit and started to help a youth find the
remote for the television. Staff 1 reported she was setting the television up for the
3

youth when Youth A, Youth B and Youth C came out of Youth C’s bedroom laughing
and told her that Youth A gave Youth C a hickey on the neck. Staff 1 reported all of
the youth thought it was funny. Staff 1 reported that youth are not allowed to enter
other youth’s bedrooms.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
 Video recording of incident shows footage that is consistent with Youth B,
Youth C and Staff 1’s interviews. Youth A did not provided any specific
information about the incident when interviewed.
 Great Lakes Recovery Centers Incident Report dated July 23, 2021. The
Incident Report was consistent with what youth and staff reported in the
interviews.
 Great Lakes Recovery Center Policy No.GL0149.0 – Staff Supervision which
states that facility requirements for line-of-sight supervision and staff-to-
youth ratios apply at all times, staff will maintain line of sight by being posted
with youth on the unit during waking hours. Staff 1 did not maintain line-of-
sight with Youth A, Youth B and Youth C.
 Staff 1 disciplinary records were reviewed and she has not had any
disciplinary actions.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 did not follow Great Lake Recovery Center Policy by
maintaining line-of-sight on Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
allowing Youth A to give Youth C a hickey on his neck. Youth A
and Youth B were in Youth C’s bedroom when Youth A gave
Youth C a hickey. Youth are not allowed in each other’s
bedroom.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

sir_summary.summary: An investigation found that at the Great Lakes Recovery Center for Youth, Youth A gave Youth C a hickey on the neck after both youths were in Youth C's bedroom, which was against facility rules. The incident occurred because Staff 1 left the youths unsupervised, violating the center's line-of-sight supervision policy. The facility is held responsible for the staff's failure to maintain proper supervision, resulting in a substantiated violation.

sir_violation_level.justification: The substantiated violation is a supervision failure. Staff 1 left youth unsupervised, violating the facility's line-of-sight supervision policy, which allowed youth to enter another youth's bedroom and engage in inappropriate physical contact (giving a hickey). This aligns with the 'Environmental or supervision failures' category for moderate SIRs, as it involves a breakdown in supervision that allowed a youth-on-youth incident to escalate.
